title: ‘The View’ Co-Host: Celebs Should Keep Their Political Beliefs To Themselves
text:
Whoopi Goldberg Becomes Incensed At Talk Of Defunding Planned Parenthood 
“I want to appreciate those films and I want to leave politics out of it,” she said. 
Bila described Streep as “a phenomenally talented actress” who has the right to her opinions, but that her speech “made her turn off” the ceremony. 
Bila’s co-hosts quickly pounced, bringing the discussion away from Streep and back to the Trump clip. 
“The point is, he mocked a person,” Whoopi Goldberg said. “He’s a mocker!” 
Joy Behar also chimed in. “At the very least, he should have the sense not to do those hand gestures to mock a reporter for being disabled,” she said. 
Trump has denied mocking the reporter. 
There was some agreement between Bila and Behar, however. Both co-hosts found common ground about Trump tweeting a reply to Streep the day after the speech, calling her “one of the most over-rated actresses in Hollywood.” 
Trump also tweeted that Streep “doesn’t know me but attacked me last night at the Golden Globes.” He called her a “Hillary flunky who lost big.” 
Behar called Trump “a baby” for responding to seemingly every public figure who criticizes him, adding “he’s not there to ‘tit for tat’ for every slight that goes through his thick skin.” 
Bila agreed. 
“It’s not his place to respond,” she said. “Donald Trump should be focused on how to fix the country.” What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
